text: common mistakes in English lesson 9
topic 2 and enough this is a lesson in
two parts part 1 understanding two and
enough
people sleep in different places from a
sofa to a futon I usually sleep on the
bed but if my children are sick or have
a very bad dream I sometimes sleep on
the floor in their room some may think
that the floor is too hard to sleep on
but first of all we have a carpet and
second if I have a pillow and a soft
blanket or two I don't think the floor
is too uncomfortable to sleep on what I
don't like is a bad mattress that's why
recently my husband and I decided to buy
a new mattress our old one was just too
lumpy
and it was sagging where he slept and it
was sad again where I slept so we
decided it was time to buy a new one a
better one we went to the store and he
chose a good mattress I will admit it
cost a lot of money some people would
say that we spent too much but I don't
think so my husband and I decided that
it was important to get a good night's
rest so we caught the mattress yesterday
the delivery truck came and brought our
mattress to us they took the old
mattress away and put the new one in
place the mattress is good but there is
a problem it's a funny one let me show
you let's pause for just a moment and
see how well you understand the
situation so far can you answer these
questions
eh when does Jennifer sleep on the floor
I said when my children are sick or when
they have a bad dream B is she
comfortable on the floor
I said yes because there's a carpet and
I'm comfortable with a pillow and a
couple of soft blankets see what did
Jennifer and her husband decide to buy a
mattress could they afford it
yes d what was wrong with the old one
the old one wasn't comfortable there
were many lumps and it was sagging all
right let's go on and you'll find out
what exactly the problem is now so
here's our bed looks nice right we'll
look again it's too high the bed is too
high when I first saw them I thought are
my legs long enough to climb onto the
bed the mattress is fine it's perfect
the mattress is fine the problem is
under the mattress under the mattress is
a box spring and the store sent the
wrong size the box spring is too big
it's too deep we need one that's smaller
it's lower the store has promised to
send a new box spring to us so tomorrow
afternoon I should have a bed that is a
normal height
all right one simple question what's the
problem is it a Jennifer wants the bed
to be higher or B Jennifer wants the bed
to be lower the answer B I said the bed
is too high in other words the bed needs
to be lower I want it to be lower I
could express the same idea by saying
the bed is not low enough so if we can
use enough in to to express the same
idea what exactly is the difference
[Music]
two means more than you want more than
you need
it's too high the bed is too high
we use enough to mean there is the
amount that you want or the amount that
you need
when I first saw this I thought are my
legs long enough to climb onto the bed
it may help to see the differences
written like this to means more than you
need or more than you want that's not
good enough
means there is the amount you need there
is the amount that you want that's good
so 2 is negative enough is positive
those meanings change however when we
put those words and negative sentences
so let's look at the example the bed is
too high it's a complaint the bed isn't
too high now it's just a comment about a
good situation here's another example
the bed is low enough a comment a good
comment the bed is not low enough now it
becomes a complaint take a moment and
review this information
let's try an exercise exercise 1 choose
the sentence that correctly describes
the situation number 1 the boy wants a
bigger bed
he says his bed is for a baby what
sentence correctly describes that
situation a he thinks the bed is big
enough B he thinks the bed is too small
answer be to the couple told the hotel
staff that they needed a wider bed which
sentence describes that situation a the
couple said that their bed was too
narrow be the couple said that their bed
wasn't too narrow
answer a3 the girl was not comfortable
sleeping on the hard floor which
sentence correctly describes that
situation a the floor was soft enough B
the floor wasn't soft enough
answer B this is the end of part 1
before you go on to part 2 please know
that additional practice is available in
English cafe comm where my username is
also Jennifer ESL try the follow-up quiz
that I've created and then I'll see you
back here for part 2
